Label: Context
Definition: Contextually relevant information
Usage: Context is a catch-all concept for information of relevance not possible to represent through other core concepts. DPV offers specific contextual concepts such as Necessity, Frequency, and Duration. More can be created by extending Context within use-cases.
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Javier Fern√°ndez, Axel Polleres, Elmar Kiesling, Fajar Ekaputra, Simon Steyskal

Label: Importance
Definition: An indication of 'importance' within a context
Usage: Importance can be used to express importance, desirability, relevance, or significance as a context.
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Paul Ryan, Georg P. Krog, Julian Flake, Beatriz Esteves

Label: Primary Importance
Definition: Indication of 'primary' or 'main' or 'core' importance
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Paul Ryan, Georg P. Krog, Julian Flake, Beatriz Esteves

Label: Secondary Importance
Definition: Indication of 'secondary' or 'minor' or 'auxiliary' importance
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Paul Ryan, Georg P. Krog, Julian Flake, Beatriz Esteves

Label: Necessity
Definition: An indication of 'necessity' within a context
Usage: Necessity can be used to express need, essentiality, requirement, or compulsion.
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Paul Ryan, Georg P. Krog, Julian Flake, Beatriz Esteves

Label: Required
Definition: Indication of 'required' or 'necessary'
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Paul Ryan, Georg P. Krog, Julian Flake, Beatriz Esteves

Label: Statutory Requirement
Definition: Indication that the requirement arises from a statutory or legal obligation
Contributors: Georg P. Krog, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Contractual Requirement
Definition: Indication that the requirement arises from a contractual obligation
Contributors: Georg P. Krog, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Entering into Contract Requirement
Definition: Indication that the requirement arises as a necessity to enter into a contract
Contributors: Georg P. Krog, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Optional
Definition: Indication of 'optional' or 'voluntary'
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Paul Ryan, Georg P. Krog, Julian Flake, Beatriz Esteves

Label: Not Required
Definition: Indication of neither being required nor optional i.e. not relevant or needed
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Paul Ryan, Georg P. Krog, Julian Flake, Beatriz Esteves

Label: Scope
Definition: Indication of the extent or range or boundaries associated with(in) a context

Label: Justification
Definition: A form of documentation providing reasons, explanations, or justifications

Label: Frequency
Definition: The frequency or information about periods and repetitions in terms of recurrence.

Label: Continuous Frequency
Definition: Frequency where occurrences are continuous

Label: Often Frequency
Definition: Frequency where occurrences are often or frequent, but not continuous

Label: Sporadic Frequency
Definition: Frequency where occurrences are sporadic or infrequent or sparse

Label: Singular Frequency
Definition: Frequency where occurrences are singular i.e. they take place only once

Label: Duration
Definition: The duration or temporal limitation

Label: Indeterminate Duration
Definition: Duration that is indeterminate or cannot be determined
Usage: Indeterminate means (exact or otherwise) information about the duration cannot be determined, which is distinct from 'EndlessDuration' where it is known (or decided) that the duration is open-ended or without an end.

Label: Endless Duration
Definition: Duration that is (known or intended to be) open ended or without an end

Label: Temporal Duration
Definition: Duration that has a fixed temporal duration e.g. 6 months

Label: Until Event Duration
Definition: Duration that takes place until a specific event occurs e.g. Account Closure

Label: Until Time Duration
Definition: Duration that has a fixed end date e.g. 2022-12-31

Label: Fixed Occurrences Duration
Definition: Duration that takes place a fixed number of times e.g. 3 times

Label: Purpose Duration
Definition: The duration associated with fulfilment or carrying out purpose(s)

Label: Consent Duration
Definition: The duration associated with fulfilment or validity of consenting decision(s)

Label: Contract Duration
Definition: The duration associated with fulfilment or carrying out contract(s)

Label: Occurrence
Definition: The occurrence of something in terms of when it occurs or applies
Usage: Useful to signal whether some processing or purpose is applicable as an initial or subsequent context

Label: Initial Occurrence
Definition: Indication that the specified context has an initial occurrence or that it applies initially or at the beginning

Label: Subsequent Occurrence
Definition: Indication that the specified context has a subsequent occurrence or that it applies after the initial occurrence or not at the beginning

Label: Applicability
Definition: Concept provided to represent indication of cases where the information or context is not applicable (N/A) or not available or this is not known or determined yet. If the information is applicable and available, this concept should not be used.
Usage: These concepts are useful in closed-world interpretations, for example in forms where a field must have a value to explicitly denote it is not applicable or the information is not available yet.

Label: Unknown Applicability
Definition: Concept indicating information or context availability is unknown i.e. it is not known if the information exists or is applicable and therefore statements about its availability cannot be made (yet)
Usage: This concept is useful when describing situations where it cannot be stated whether the context applies or whether the information is not available yet. For example, if a form field asks about whether a process X was completed and it is not yet known whether X applies or not and therefore it is also unclear whether X was completed or not. Using UnknownApplicability is a signal that the applicability of X should be assessed, and if applicable, then information about X should be identified and used here.

Label: Not Applicable
Definition: Concept indicating the information or context is not applicable
Usage: This relates to a 'Stop' state as distinct from a 'Halt' state. It makes no comments on whether the Activity can be resumed or continued towards completion.

Label: Not Available
Definition: Concept indicating the information or context is applicable but information is not yet available
Usage: This concept is useful when describing situations where information is required but is not available (yet). For example, if in a form a field asks about whether a process X was completed, and it is correct to interpret that process X is applicable and must be completed, but the information is not yet available as to whether this was done - then NotAvailable is useful to represent this.

Label: Fee Requirement
Definition: Concept indicating whether a fee is required
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Fee Required
Definition: Concept indicating a fee is required. The value of the fee should be specified using rdf:value or an another relevant means
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Fee Not Required
Definition: Concept indicating a fee is not required. This is distinct from a Fee of zero as it indicates a fee is not applicable in the context
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog
